value.title: The AI community says Black Lives Matter, but more work needs to be done
value.excerpt: The AI community stood with the Black Lives Matter movement in a meaningful way this week, but work remains to be done to affect change.

value.title: Facebook creates shopping data sets to make more humanlike chatbots

value.title: Regulating Artificial Intelligence: Why We Need Expert Input To Limit Risks
value.excerpt: Businesses must figure out how to deploy AI in a way that does not harm consumers, violate consumers' privacy or otherwise run afoul of laws.

images.title: Regulating Artificial Intelligence: Why We Need Expert Input To Limit Risks

value.title: Facebook, PayPal back Indonesian start-up Gojek’s Asia digital payments push
value.excerpt: The deal announced Wednesday marks Facebook’s first investment in an Indonesian company and is a major boost for Gojek, the country’s largest start-up which made its name in the ride-hailing business.

value.title: Owkin Raises $25M to Enhance Medical Research Machine Learning and Collaboration
value.excerpt: Owkin is fueling collaborative medical research using machine learning while being compliant with privacy laws. Thomas Clozel discusses the unique benefits of Owkin.

value.title: Facebook AI Research applies Transformer architecture to streamline object detection models
value.excerpt: Facebook AI researchers claim they created the first object detection model with the Transformer neural network architecture typically used for NLP.

value.title: It’s The Data, Stupid! Why AI Might Get It Wrong.
value.excerpt: Artificial Intelligence is based on data. But that data might not be sufficient, biased, or out-right wrong. To have control over AI we need tools to check for biases.

images.title: It’s The Data, Stupid! Why AI Might Get It Wrong.

value.title: Clearview AI faces lawsuit over gathering people's images without consent
value.excerpt: Clearview AI has spent months amassing its facial recognition database with more than 3 billion pictures of people it gathered from the internet. Now it faces a lawsuit in Illinois for taking those photos without people's consent.

images.title: Clearview AI faces lawsuit over gathering people's images without consent

value.title: Nvidia AI creates a playable version of Pac-Man without any source code
value.excerpt: Up until now, that's seemingly been the case, but one Nvidia-created AI is challenging the norm. To celebrate Pac-Man's 40th anniversary, the hardware maker fed a computer farm a whopping 50,000 "episodes" of gameplay from the title -- but

images.title: Nvidia AI creates a playable version of Pac-Man without any source code

value.title: Nvidia teaches AI to create new version of Pac-Man just by watching gameplay
value.excerpt: Nvidia researchers have used generative adversarial networks (GANs) to create a new version of Pac-Man that recreated without studying the game's code

images.title: Nvidia teaches AI to create new version of Pac-Man just by watching gameplay

value.title: Nvidia’s AI recreates Pac-Man from scratch just by watching it being played
value.excerpt: For its latest project, Nvidia researchers taught an AI system to recreate the game of Pac-Man simply by watching it being played. There’s no coding involved, no pre-rendered images for the software to draw on.

images.title: Nvidia’s AI recreates Pac-Man from scratch just by watching it being played

value.title: Facebook’s Giphy purchase will help keep track of competitors
value.excerpt: Giphy provides the same search service to many of Facebook’s competitors – including Apple’s iMessage, Twitter, Signal and TikTok – which shows how often people use these platforms, the kind of insight Facebook values most.

value.title: Facebook’s voice synthesis AI generates speech in 500 milliseconds
value.excerpt: Facebook's new AI text-to-speech system generates one second of human-like audio in just 500 milliseconds, running on off-the-shelf processors.

images.title: Facebook’s voice synthesis AI generates speech in 500 milliseconds

value.title: Facebook Offers $50K For AI That Can Detect Hateful Memes
value.excerpt: Facebook's created a dataset of 10,000 ‘hateful’ memes and is offering prizes totaling $100,000 for developers who can use it to detect hate speech in memes.

images.title: Facebook Offers $50K For AI That Can Detect Hateful Memes

value.title: Facebook's AI for Hate Speech Improves. How Much Is Unclear
value.excerpt: The company says algorithms flagged almost 90 percent of the hate speech it removed in the first quarter. But it doesn't report how much slipped through.

images.title: Facebook's AI for Hate Speech Improves. How Much Is Unclear

value.title: Facebook upgrades its AI to better tackle COVID-19 misinformation and hate speech
value.excerpt: Facebook’s AI tools are the only thing standing between its users and the growing onslaught of hate and misinformation the platform is experiencing. The company’s researchers have cooked up a few new capabilities for the systems that keep the adversary at bay,

images.title: Facebook upgrades its AI to better tackle COVID-19 misinformation and hate speech

value.title: AI is still largely baffled by covid misinformation
value.excerpt: In its latest Community Standards Enforcement Report, released today, Facebook detailed the updates it has made to its AI systems for detecting hate speech and disinformation. The tech giant says 88.8% of all the hate speech it removed this quarter was detected by AI,

images.title: AI is still largely baffled by covid misinformation

value.title: Facebook says AI has a ways to go to detect nasty memes
value.excerpt: Facebook has developed a data set consisting of 10,000 “hateful” memes and suggests that computer models that can “fuse” multiple signal types, such as text and image, are the way forward for classifying content such as hate speech.

images.title: Facebook says AI has a ways to go to detect nasty memes

value.title: Twitter Names Former Google Executive to Its Board to Boost Its AI Chops
value.excerpt: Fei Li, the former Google executive, and Stanford professor is coming on board to help expand Twitter's use of AI on its platform.

images.title: Twitter Names Former Google Executive to Its Board to Boost Its AI Chops

value.title: How Facebook is using AI to combat COVID-19 misinformation and detect ‘hateful memes’
value.excerpt: That’s because Facebook is relying more on the technology to help moderate its platform during the COVID-19 pandemic, which is preventing the company from using its usual third-party moderator firms because those firms’ employees are not allowed to access sensitive Facebook data from home computers.

images.title: How Facebook is using AI to combat COVID-19 misinformation and detect ‘hateful memes’

value.title: Facebook deploys AI in its fight against hate speech and misinformation
value.excerpt: The company has long sought to rein in the prevalence of hate speech spread on its site. Detecting hate speech is no easy feat. The company is even tackling hate memes.

images.title: Facebook deploys AI in its fight against hate speech and misinformation
